thread.title: Strictly Come Dancing's Daniel O'Donnell: 'I was competing against my nerves' - TV
thread.title_full: Strictly Come Dancing's Daniel O'Donnell: 'I was competing against my nerves' - TV News - Digital Spy

author: Ian Sandwell
title: Strictly Come Dancing's Daniel O'Donnell: 'I was competing against my nerves' - TV
text: Daniel O'Donnell has admitted that nerves played a big part in his exit from Strictly Come Dancing.The singer noted that as much as he enjoyed Strictly, there was consistently something in his way when it came to dancing to a choreographed piece. © BBC / Guy Levy "I tried, I have to say I tried, but I didn't feel as comfortable as I thought I would before the competition started," he said."If I could have sorted my own nerves out, it would have been a tremendous experience for me."Really, every Saturday night I was dancing against my nerves – I wasn't competing against anybody!"O'Donnell added that he forgot everything in the dance-off - "my feet stuck to the floor!" - and that his nerves "didn't allow me to express myself as good as I could". © BBC Every cloud has a silver lining, though, and he concluded that he was glad his nerves didn't lead to his professional partner Kristina Rihanoff getting hurt."When you're starting out [with the lifts], you're not confident, but you're careful. We had no accidents or anything – we were lucky." Following his exit, O'Donnell has also spoken about defending Rihanoff from negativity in the media.Strictly Come Dancing airs next weekend on Saturday, October 24 at 6.35pm and Sunday, October 25 at 7.15pm on BBC One.
